verses.kjv: And when the day of Pentecost was fully come, they were all with one accord in one place.
verses.web: Now when the day of Pentecost had come, they were all with one accord in one place.
verses.ct: When the day of Pentecost arrived, all the believers were gathered together in one place.

verses.kjv: And suddenly there came a sound from heaven as of a rushing mighty wind, and it filled all the house where they were sitting.
verses.web: Suddenly there came from the sky a sound like the rushing of a mighty wind, and it filled all the house where they were sitting.
verses.ct: Suddenly a sound came from heaven like a powerful, rushing wind, and it filled the entire house where they were sitting.

verses.kjv: And there appeared unto them cloven tongues like as of fire, and it sat upon each of them.
verses.web: Tongues like fire appeared and were distributed to them, and one sat on each of them.
verses.ct: Then what looked like flames of fire appeared, splitting apart and resting on each one of them.

verses.kjv: And they were all filled with the Holy Ghost, and began to speak with other tongues, as the Spirit gave them utterance.
verses.web: They were all filled with the Holy Spirit, and began to speak with other languages, as the Spirit gave them the ability to speak.
verses.ct: They were all filled with the Holy Spirit and began speaking in other languages as the Spirit gave them the ability.

verses.kjv: And there were dwelling at Jerusalem Jews, devout men, out of every nation under heaven.
verses.web: Now there were dwelling in Jerusalem Jews, devout men, from every nation under the sky.
verses.ct: Now there were devout Jews living in Jerusalem who had come from every nation under heaven.

verses.kjv: Now when this was noised abroad, the multitude came together, and were confounded, because that every man heard them speak in his own language.
verses.web: When this sound was heard, the multitude came together and were bewildered, because everyone heard them speaking in his own language.
verses.ct: When the sound rang out, a crowd gathered — and they were completely bewildered, because each person heard the believers speaking in his own native language.

verses.kjv: And they were all amazed and marvelled, saying one to another, Behold, are not all these which speak Galilaeans?
verses.web: They were all amazed and marveled, saying to one another, “Behold, aren’t all these who speak Galileans?
verses.ct: Stunned and amazed, they said to each other, "Wait — aren't all these people who are speaking Galileans?

verses.kjv: And how hear we every man in our own tongue, wherein we were born?
verses.web: How do we hear, everyone in our own native language?
verses.ct: Then how is it that each of us hears them in the language we grew up speaking?

verses.kjv: Parthians, and Medes, and Elamites, and the dwellers in Mesopotamia, and in Judaea, and Cappadocia, in Pontus, and Asia,
verses.web: Parthians, Medes, Elamites, and people from Mesopotamia, Judea, Cappadocia, Pontus, Asia,
verses.ct: Parthians, Medes, Elamites, people from Mesopotamia, Judaea, Cappadocia, Pontus, Asia,

verses.kjv: Phrygia, and Pamphylia, in Egypt, and in the parts of Libya about Cyrene, and strangers of Rome, Jews and proselytes,
verses.web: Phrygia, Pamphylia, Egypt, the parts of Libya around Cyrene, visitors from Rome, both Jews and proselytes,
verses.ct: Phrygia, Pamphylia, Egypt, the parts of Libya near Cyrene, visitors from Rome — both Jews and converts to Judaism —

verses.kjv: Cretes and Arabians, we do hear them speak in our tongues the wonderful works of God.
verses.web: Cretans and Arabians: we hear them speaking in our languages the mighty works of God!”
verses.ct: Cretans and Arabians — we all hear them declaring the mighty works of God in our own languages!"

verses.kjv: And they were all amazed, and were in doubt, saying one to another, What meaneth this?
verses.web: They were all amazed, and were perplexed, saying to one another, “What does this mean?”
verses.ct: Everyone was amazed and confused, asking each other, "What does this mean?"

verses.kjv: Others mocking said, These men are full of new wine.
verses.web: Others, mocking, said, “They are filled with new wine.”
verses.ct: But others made fun of them, saying, "They've just had too much wine."

verses.kjv: But Peter, standing up with the eleven, lifted up his voice, and said unto them, Ye men of Judaea, and all ye that dwell at Jerusalem, be this known unto you, and hearken to my words:
verses.web: But Peter, standing up with the eleven, lifted up his voice, and spoke out to them, “You men of Judea, and all you who dwell at Jerusalem, let this be known to you, and listen to my words.
verses.ct: Then Peter stood up with the 11 apostles, raised his voice, and addressed the crowd: "People of Judaea and everyone living in Jerusalem, listen carefully to what I have to say.

verses.kjv: For these are not drunken, as ye suppose, seeing it is but the third hour of the day.
verses.web: For these aren’t drunken, as you suppose, seeing it is only the third hour of the day.
verses.ct: These people aren't drunk, as you're assuming. It's only 9 in the morning!

verses.kjv: But this is that which was spoken by the prophet Joel;
verses.web: But this is what has been spoken through the prophet Joel:
verses.ct: No, this is what the prophet Joel spoke about:

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass in the last days, saith God, I will pour out of my Spirit upon all flesh: and your sons and your daughters shall prophesy, and your young men shall see visions, and your old men shall dream dreams:
verses.web: ‘It will be in the last days, says God, that I will pour out my Spirit on all flesh. Your sons and your daughters will prophesy. Your young men will see visions. Your old men will dream dreams.
verses.ct: 'In the last days, God says, I will pour out my Spirit on all people. Your sons and daughters will prophesy, your young men will see visions, and your old men will dream dreams.

verses.kjv: And on my servants and on my handmaidens I will pour out in those days of my Spirit; and they shall prophesy:
verses.web: Yes, and on my servants and on my handmaidens in those days, I will pour out my Spirit, and they will prophesy.
verses.ct: Even on my servants, both men and women, I will pour out my Spirit in those days, and they will prophesy.

verses.kjv: And I will shew wonders in heaven above, and signs in the earth beneath; blood, and fire, and vapour of smoke:
verses.web: I will show wonders in the sky above, and signs on the earth beneath: blood, and fire, and billows of smoke.
verses.ct: I will show wonders in the heavens above and signs on the earth below — blood, fire, and billowing smoke.

verses.kjv: The sun shall be turned into darkness, and the moon into blood, before that great and notable day of the Lord come:
verses.web: The sun will be turned into darkness, and the moon into blood, before the great and glorious day of the Lord comes.
verses.ct: The sun will turn to darkness and the moon to blood before the great and glorious day of the Lord arrives.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, that whosoever shall call on the name of the Lord shall be saved.
verses.web: It will be that whoever will call on the name of the Lord will be saved.’
verses.ct: And everyone who calls on the name of the Lord will be saved.'

verses.kjv: Ye men of Israel, hear these words; Jesus of Nazareth, a man approved of God among you by miracles and wonders and signs, which God did by him in the midst of you, as ye yourselves also know:
verses.web: “Men of Israel, hear these words! Jesus of Nazareth, a man approved by God to you by mighty works and wonders and signs which God did by him among you, even as you yourselves know,
verses.ct: "People of Israel, listen! Jesus of Nazareth was a man whose authority God confirmed to you through miracles, wonders, and signs that God performed through him right here among you — as you yourselves know.

verses.kjv: Him, being delivered by the determinate counsel and foreknowledge of God, ye have taken, and by wicked hands have crucified and slain:
verses.web: him, being delivered up by the determined counsel and foreknowledge of God, you have taken by the hand of lawless men, crucified and killed;
verses.ct: This man was handed over to you by God's deliberate plan and foreknowledge, and you used lawless men to nail him to a cross and kill him.

verses.kjv: Whom God hath raised up, having loosed the pains of death: because it was not possible that he should be holden of it.
verses.web: whom God raised up, having freed him from the agony of death, because it was not possible that he should be held by it.
verses.ct: But God raised him from the dead, freeing him from the agony of death, because death could not hold him.

verses.kjv: For David speaketh concerning him, I foresaw the Lord always before my face, for he is on my right hand, that I should not be moved:
verses.web: For David says concerning him, ‘I saw the Lord always before my face, for he is on my right hand, that I should not be moved.
verses.ct: David said this about him: 'I always kept the Lord before me. Because he is at my right hand, I will not be shaken.

verses.kjv: Therefore did my heart rejoice, and my tongue was glad; moreover also my flesh shall rest in hope:
verses.web: Therefore my heart was glad, and my tongue rejoiced. Moreover my flesh also will dwell in hope;
verses.ct: That is why my heart is glad and my tongue rejoices. Even my body will rest in hope,

verses.kjv: Because thou wilt not leave my soul in hell, neither wilt thou suffer thine Holy One to see corruption.
verses.web: because you will not leave my soul in Hades, neither will you allow your Holy One to see decay.
verses.ct: because you will not abandon my soul to the grave, and you will not let your Holy One experience decay.

verses.kjv: Thou hast made known to me the ways of life; thou shalt make me full of joy with thy countenance.
verses.web: You made known to me the ways of life. You will make me full of gladness with your presence.’
verses.ct: You have shown me the path of life; you will fill me with joy in your presence.'

verses.kjv: Men and brethren, let me freely speak unto you of the patriarch David, that he is both dead and buried, and his sepulchre is with us unto this day.
verses.web: “Brothers, I may tell you freely of the patriarch David, that he both died and was buried, and his tomb is with us to this day.
verses.ct: "Brothers, let me speak plainly about the patriarch David: he died, he was buried, and his tomb is still here among us to this day.

verses.kjv: Therefore being a prophet, and knowing that God had sworn with an oath to him, that of the fruit of his loins, according to the flesh, he would raise up Christ to sit on his throne;
verses.web: Therefore, being a prophet, and knowing that God had sworn with an oath to him that of the fruit of his body, according to the flesh, he would raise up the Christ to sit on his throne,
verses.ct: But David was a prophet, and he knew that God had sworn an oath to him — that one of his own descendants would sit on his throne as the Christ.

verses.kjv: He seeing this before spake of the resurrection of Christ, that his soul was not left in hell, neither his flesh did see corruption.
verses.web: he foreseeing this spoke about the resurrection of the Christ, that his soul wasn’t left in Hades, and his flesh didn’t see decay.
verses.ct: Seeing what was coming, David spoke about the resurrection of the Christ — that his soul would not be abandoned to the grave, and his body would not experience decay.

verses.kjv: This Jesus hath God raised up, whereof we all are witnesses.
verses.web: This Jesus God raised up, to which we all are witnesses.
verses.ct: God raised this Jesus to life, and every one of us is a witness to it.

verses.kjv: Therefore being by the right hand of God exalted, and having received of the Father the promise of the Holy Ghost, he hath shed forth this, which ye now see and hear.
verses.web: Being therefore exalted by the right hand of God, and having received from the Father the promise of the Holy Spirit, he has poured out this, which you now see and hear.
verses.ct: He has been lifted to the highest place at God's right hand. He received the promised Holy Spirit from the Father and has poured out what you are now seeing and hearing.

verses.kjv: For David is not ascended into the heavens: but he saith himself, The Lord said unto my Lord, Sit thou on my right hand,
verses.web: For David didn’t ascend into the heavens, but he says himself, ‘The Lord said to my Lord, “Sit by my right hand
verses.ct: David himself did not ascend into the heavens, yet he said, 'The Lord said to my Lord, "Sit at my right hand

verses.kjv: Until I make thy foes thy footstool.
verses.web: until I make your enemies a footstool for your feet.” ’
verses.ct: until I make your enemies a footstool for your feet."'

verses.kjv: Therefore let all the house of Israel know assuredly, that God hath made that same Jesus, whom ye have crucified, both Lord and Christ.
verses.web: “Let all the house of Israel therefore know certainly that God has made him both Lord and Christ, this Jesus whom you crucified.”
verses.ct: "So let everyone in Israel know this beyond any doubt: God has made this Jesus — the very one you crucified — both Lord and Christ."

verses.kjv: Now when they heard this, they were pricked in their heart, and said unto Peter and to the rest of the apostles, Men and brethren, what shall we do?
verses.web: Now when they heard this, they were cut to the heart, and said to Peter and the rest of the apostles, “Brothers, what shall we do?”
verses.ct: When the people heard this, it cut them to the heart. They cried out to Peter and the other apostles, "Brothers, what should we do?"

verses.kjv: Then Peter said unto them, Repent, and be baptized every one of you in the name of Jesus Christ for the remission of sins, and ye shall receive the gift of the Holy Ghost.
verses.web: Peter said to them, “Repent, and be baptized, every one of you, in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of sins, and you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.
verses.ct: Peter answered, "Repent and be baptized, every one of you, in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of your sins, and you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.

verses.kjv: For the promise is unto you, and to your children, and to all that are afar off, even as many as the LORD our God shall call.
verses.web: For the promise is to you, and to your children, and to all who are far off, even as many as the Lord our God will call to himself.”
verses.ct: This promise is for you, for your children, and for everyone who is far away — for everyone the LORD our God will call."

verses.kjv: And with many other words did he testify and exhort, saying, Save yourselves from this untoward generation.
verses.web: With many other words he testified, and exhorted them, saying, “Save yourselves from this crooked generation!”
verses.ct: Peter kept urging them with many more words, pleading, "Save yourselves from this corrupt generation!"

verses.kjv: Then they that gladly received his word were baptized: and the same day there were added unto them about three thousand souls.
verses.web: Then those who gladly received his word were baptized. There were added that day about three thousand souls.
verses.ct: Those who accepted his message were baptized, and about 3,000 people were added to their number that day.

verses.kjv: And they continued stedfastly in the apostles’ doctrine and fellowship, and in breaking of bread, and in prayers.
verses.web: They continued steadfastly in the apostles’ teaching and fellowship, in the breaking of bread, and prayer.
verses.ct: They devoted themselves to the apostles' teaching, to fellowship with one another, to the breaking of bread, and to prayer.

verses.kjv: And fear came upon every soul: and many wonders and signs were done by the apostles.
verses.web: Fear came on every soul, and many wonders and signs were done through the apostles.
verses.ct: A deep sense of fear came over everyone, and the apostles performed many wonders and signs.

verses.kjv: And all that believed were together, and had all things common;
verses.web: All who believed were together, and had all things in common.
verses.ct: All the believers stayed together and shared everything they had.

verses.kjv: And sold their possessions and goods, and parted them to all men, as every man had need.
verses.web: They sold their possessions and goods, and distributed them to all, according as anyone had need.
verses.ct: They sold their property and possessions and distributed the money to anyone who was in need.

verses.kjv: And they, continuing daily with one accord in the temple, and breaking bread from house to house, did eat their meat with gladness and singleness of heart,
verses.web: Day by day, continuing steadfastly with one accord in the temple, and breaking bread at home, they took their food with gladness and singleness of heart,
verses.ct: Every day they met together at the temple with united hearts, and they shared meals in each other's homes, eating with joy and genuine generosity,

verses.kjv: Praising God, and having favour with all the people. And the Lord added to the church daily such as should be saved.
verses.web: praising God, and having favor with all the people. The Lord added to the assembly day by day those who were being saved.
verses.ct: praising God and enjoying the goodwill of all the people. And every day the Lord added to their number those who were being saved.
